intro: Gonzalagunia haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian rock fig, is a rare and endemic species native to Haiti. It is a small, shrub-like plant characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and unique, fig-like fruits. The plant thrives in rocky, limestone soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. It plays a vital role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Gonzalagunia haitiensis is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
